citeinfo.origin: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
citeinfo.title: Tax Lots New York City 2006

pubinfo.publish: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

citeinfo.origin: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
citeinfo.title: City of New York, NY Planning

pubinfo.publish: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

descript.abstract: This polygon dataset represents tax lots in New York, NY. The data was created from a compilation of various government agencies throughout New York, NY. The underlying geography is derived from the Department of City Planning's Tax Block and Tax Lot Base Map project. The tax lots have been clipped to the shoreline, as defined by NYCMap planimetric features. The attribute information is the Department of City Planning's PLUTO database application. The attribute data pertains to tax lot and primary building characteristics and information related to administrative and political districts for each tax lot in New York, NY. The Tax Lot Basemap and PLUTO are derived from different sources. As a result, some PLUTO records did not have a corresponding tax lot in the base map at the time of release.
descript.purpose: This dataset is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.

cntinfo.cntpos: BYTES of the BIG APPLE Coordinator

attracc.attraccr: The Department of City Planning makes no assurances about the accuracy of these data.

horizpa.horizpar: The MapPLUTO files are created from the Department of City Planning COGIS Tax Lot base map file. The Department of City Planning conflated (i.e., graphically aligned) the COGIS files to precision aerial photography of the city.

procstep.procdesc: Separate shapefiles were merged: bkmappluto, bxmappluto, mnmappluto, qnmappluto, simappluto. New file name is NYXTaxLots06.

cntorgp.cntorg: Tufts University Geographic Information Systems Center.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.
attr.attrdefs: Environmental Systems Research Institute (Redlands, Calif.)

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
attr.attrdefs: Environmental Systems Research Institute (Redlands, Calif.)

attr.attrdef: The borough in which the tax lot is located.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: Two portions of the city, Marble Hill and Rikers Island, are each legally located in one borough but are serviced by different boroughs. The BOROUGH codes associated with these areas are the boroughs they are legally located in. Specifically, Marble hill is serviced by the Bronx but is legally located in Manhattan and has a Manhattan BOROUGH code. Rikers Island has a Bronx BOROUGH code because it is legally located in the Bronx although it is serviced by Queens.

attr.attrdef: The tax block in which the tax lot is located. Each tax block is unique within a borough
attr.attrdefs: New York (City). Bureau of Real Property Assessment

attr.attrdef: The number of the tax lot. Each tax lot is unique within a tax block.
attr.attrdefs: New York (City). Bureau of Real Property Assessment

attrvai.attrvae: Each unit in a building that is a condominium is defined by the Department of Finance as a separate tax lot. To make condominium information more compatible with parcel information, the Deparment of City Planning aggregated condominium unit tax lot information so that each condominium complex within a tax block is represented by only one tax lot record. A condominium complex is defined as one or more structures or properties under the auspicies of the same condominium association. The Department of City Planning then assigned the condominium billing tax lot number to the condominium complex tax lot record. If the Department of Finance has not yet assigned a billing tax lot number to the condominium complex then the lowest tax lot number within the condominium complex was used.

attr.attrdef: Community district (CD) or joint interest area (JIA) the tax lot is located in, or partially located.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Staten Island Gateway National Recreation Area (JIA)

attrvai.attrva: Only one data source is used per tax lot.
attrvai.attrvae: The Tax Block and Lot Not Clipped to Shoreline File is used as the source when Tax Block and Lot Not Clipped to Shoreline File identifies a community district for a tax lot. Otherwise the community district number is obtained from the Department of City Planning Geosupport System. If the community district is not available from the Geosupport System the DOF-RPAD Master File is used.Two portions of the city, Marble Hill and Rikers Island, are legally located in one borough and are each serviced by different boroughs. The cd2 codes associated with these areas are the community districts they are serviced by. Specifically, Marble Hill is legally located in Manhattan but is serviced by the Bronx and has Bronx cd2 codes of 207 or 208. Rikers Island has a Queens cd2 code of 401 since it is serviced by Queens even though it is legally located in the Bronx.

attr.attrdef: The 2000 US Census tract in which the tax lot is located. Each census tract identifier is unique within a borough.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: 2000 census tratcts a geographic areas defined by the US Census Bureau for the 2000 Census.

attr.attrdef: The 2000 census block in which the tax lot is located. Each census block is unique within a census tract
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: The community school district in which the tax lot is located.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: There are currently 51 city council districts in the City, which serve as administrative districts for the legislative branch of city government.

attr.attrdef: The zip code that the tax lot is located in.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: The zip code is obtained from the Department of City Planning- Geosupport System. If the zip code is not available from Geosupport, the DOF-RPAD Master File is used.

attr.attrdef: The fire company that services the tax lot. This field consists of four characters, the first of which is an alphabetic code identifying the type of fire company, where E stands for Engine and L stands for Ladder. The type code is followed by a one to three digit fire company number which is preceded with leading zeros if the company number is less than three digits.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: The health area in which the tax lot is located. Health areas are administrative districts comprised of aggregates of census tracts, which are used by the Health Department for statistical data collection.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: The health center district in which the tax lot is located. Heath Center Districts are administrative districts comprised of health areas
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: The police precinct in which the tax lot is located.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: An address for the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: The general format is house number or low house number, if there is a house number range, and a space followed by a street name. Queens house numbers contain a hyphen. Some tax lots, such as vacant lots or parks, have a street name and no house number.

attr.attrdef: The primary zoning district classification of the tax lot. If the tax lot is divided by a zoning boundary line, zoneDist1, represents the primary zoning district classification occupying the greatest percentage of the tax lot's area.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Property under the jurisdiction of NYS Office of Parks, Recreation, and Historic Preservation.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: See SplitZone to determine if the tax lot is divided.

attr.attrdef: If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, zoneDist2, represents the primary zoning classification occupying the second greatest percentage of the tax lot's area. If the tax lot is not divided by a zoning boundary line, the field is blank.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: See SplitZone to determine if the tax lot is divided.

attr.attrdef: The commercial overlay assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: If more than one commercial overlay exist on the tax lot, Overlay1 represents the commercial overlay occupying the greatest precentage of the lot area. If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary line, Overlay1 could be associated with either ZoneDist1 or ZoneDist2.

attr.attrdef: A commercial overlay associated with the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: If the tax lot has only one zoning district, Overlay2 represents the commercial overlay occupying the second largest percentageof the tax lot's area. If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, Overlay2 could be associated with either ZoneDist1 or ZoneDist2.

attr.attrdef: The special purpose or limited height district assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Atlantic Avenue District (Eliminated & replaced by Downtown Brooklyn District)
Brooklyn Center Development District (Eliminated 10/9/86, N860210 ZRK)
Fifth Avenue District (Eliminated & replaced by Midtown District)
Fulton Mall District (Eliminated & replaced by Downtown Brooklyn District)
Greenwich Street Development District (Eliminated & replaced by Lower Manhattan District)
Hunters Point Mixed Use District (Eliminated & replaced by Long Island City Mixed Use District)
Long Island City Mixed Use District
Lower Manhattan Mixed Use District (Renamed Tribeca Mixed Use District)
Manhattan Landing District (Eliminated & replaced by Lower Manhattan District)
Mixed Use District-9 Northern Hunters Point Waterfront (QN)
South Street Seaport District (Eliminated & replaced by Lower Manhattan District)
Theater District (Eliminated & replaced by Midtown District)
Tribeca Mixed Use District (Was Lower Manhattan Mixed Use District, Renamed 8/27/98)
Yorkville - East 86th Street District (Eliminated 6/29/89, N880799 ZRM)

attrvai.attrvae: If more than special district exists on the tax lot, SPDist1 represents the special district or limited height designation occupying the greatest precentage of the lot area. If the tax lot is divided by a zoning boundary line SPDist1 could be associated with either ZoneDist1 or ZoneDist2.

attr.attrdef: The special purpose or limited height district assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: If more than special district exists on the tax lot, SPDist2 represents the special district or limited height designation occupying the greatest precentage of the lot area. If the tax lot is divided by a zoning boundary line SPDist2 could be associated with either ZoneDist1 or ZoneDist2.

attr.attrdef: Consists of the primary zoning classification occupying the greatest percentage of the tax lot's area and a commercial overlay and special purpose or limited height district assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: If a tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, AllZoning1 may contain zoning components from various portions of the lot.

attr.attrdef: If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, AllZoning2 consists of the primary zoning classification occupying the second greatest percentage of the tax lot's area and a commercial overlay and special purpose or limited height district assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File, Department of City Planning - Zoning Resolution Maps

edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: If a tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, zoning2 may contain zoning components from various portions of the lot.

attr.attrdef: A code indicating whether the tax lot is split by one or more zoning boundary lines.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File

edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrva: Less than 2% of the tax lots are split.

attr.attrdef: A code describing the major use of structures on the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Deparment of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: If there are multiple uses or buildings on a tax lot, the building class describes the use with the greatest square footage on the tax lot. Several building classes describe mixed use buildings (combinations of residential and office or retail uses).

attr.attrdef: A code for the tax lot's land use category, modified for display of parks, New York City Department of Parks and Recreation properties and New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation properties in the appropriate category on land use maps.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: A tax lot's land use category is derived from the lot's building class (see bldgClass). The Department of City Planning assigned building classes to the most appropriate land use category. Park properties were identified using data sources other than the DOF Building Classes and, where appropriate, were classified with a Land Use Category of 09- Open Space and Outdoor Recreation, regardless of the tax lot's building class.

attr.attrdef: The number of easements on the tax lot. If the number is zero, the tax lot has no easement.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: A code indicating type of ownership for the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Other - Public Authority, State or Federal Ownership
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Private Ownership - Either the tax lot has started an "in rem" action or it was onced city owned.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Mixed (Excludes property with a C, M, O, or P ownership code). Fully tax exempt property that could be owned by the city, state, or federal government; a public authority; or a private institution.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: It is recommended that OwnerName be referenced to verify the type of ownership, specifically when state and federal government and public authority ownership is important.

attr.attrdef: The name of the owner of the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: Total area of the tax lot, expressed in square feet rounded to the nearest
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: Lot Area contains street beds when the tax lot contains paper streets, i.e. oficially mapped but not built. If the tax lot is not an irregularly shaped lot (irrLotCode) the Department of Finance derives the Lot Area by multiplying the Lot Frontage by the Lot Depth. If the tax lot is irregularly shaped Finance manually calculates the Lot Area from the Tax Maps. If the lot area is zero, data is not available for the tax lot.

attr.attrdef: The total gross area in square feet.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrva: The sum of ComArea ad ResArea does not always equal the floor area.
attrvai.attrvae: If AreaSource field has a code of 1 or 2, the total floor area is for all of the buildings on the tax lot. Measurements are based on exterior dimensions. The building floor area is calculated by multiplying the building footprint by the number of stories, where the number of stories includes all full and partial stories above the ground floor. If the AreaSource field has a value of 5, the floor area was calculated from the DOF RPAD Master File using the building dimensions and number of stories for ONLY the largest building on the tax lot.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for commercial use.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrva: The sum of the various floor areas does not always equal the floor area.
attrvai.attrvae: This information is only collected for Tax Class 2 and Tax Class 4 properties. A commercial area of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for residential use.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: This information is only collected for Tax Class 2 and Tax Class 4 properties. A floor area of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. The sum of the various floor areas does not always equal FLOORAREA.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for office use.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: This information is only collected for Tax Class 2 and Tax Class 4 properties. A floor area of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. The sum of the various floor areas does not always equal FLOORAREA.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for retail use.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: This information is only collected for Tax Class 2 and Tax Class 4 properties. A floor area of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. The sum of the various floor areas does not always equal FLOORAREA.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for garage use.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrvae: This information is only collected for Tax Class 2 and Tax Class 4 properties. A floor area of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. The sum of the various floor areas does not always equal FLOORAREA.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for storage or loft purposes.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrvae: This information is only collected for Tax Class 2 and Tax Class 4 properties. A floor area of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. The sum of the various floor areas does not always equal FLOORAREA.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for factory use.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrvae: This information is only collected for Tax Class 2 and Tax Class 4 properties. A floor area of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. The sum of the various floor areas does not always equal FLOORAREA.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for other than Residential, Office, Retail, Garage, Storage, Loft or Factory use.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrvae: This information is only collected for Tax Class 2 and Tax Class 4 properties. A floor area of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. The sum of the various floor areas does not always equal FLOORAREA.

attr.attrdef: A code indicating the source file that was used to determine the tax lot's BldgArea.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Department of Finance's Major Property File
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: One or more Building Dimensions are non-numeric. Total Building Floor Area is 0.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Building Class is 'V' and Number of Buildings is 0. Total Building Floor Area is 0.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Total Building Floor Area is calculated from RPAD Building Dimensions and Number of Stories for largest building only.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Department of Finance?s Mass Appraisal System
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: The number of buildings on the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrva: With few exceptions, buildings are permanent structures. If an assessor values a semi-permanent structure, such as a parking attendants building, then it is considered a building.

attr.attrdef: In the primary building on the tax lot, the number of full and partial stories starting from the ground floor.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrvae: If the number of floors is zero and the number of buildings is greater than zero, the number of floors is not available for the tax lot. If the number of floors is zero and the number of buildings is zero, then the number of floors is not applicable for the tax lot.

attr.attrdef: The sum of residential units in all buildings on the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrvae: Hotels/motels, nursing homes and SROs do not have residential units, while boarding houses do have residential units.

attr.attrdef: The sum of residential and non-residential (offices, retail stores, etc.) units in all buildings on the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrvae: The count of non-residential units is sometimes not available if the building contains residential units.

attr.attrdef: The tax lot's frontage measured in feet.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attr.attrdef: The tax lot's depth measured in feet.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attr.attrdef: The building's frontage along the street measured in feet.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attr.attrdef: The building's depth, which is the effective perpendicular distance, measured in feet.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attr.attrdef: The physical relationship of the building to neighboring buildings.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attr.attrdef: A code indicating whether the tax lot is irregularly shaped.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attr.attrdef: A code indicating the location of the tax lot to another tax lot and/or the water.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Block Assemblage - A tax lot which encompasses an entire block.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Waterfront - A tax lot bordering on a body of water. Waterfront lots may contain a small amount of submerged land.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Corner - A tax lot bordering on two intersecting streets
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Through - A tax lot which connects two streets and fronts on both streets. A lot with two frontages is not necessarily a through lot. For example, an L-shaped lot with two frontages would be coded as an Inside Lot (5).
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Inside - A tax lot which is not an assemblage, waterfront, corner, through, interior, island, alley or submerged lot.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Interior Lot - A tax lot that has no street frontage.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Island Lot - A tax lot that is entirely surrounded by water.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Alley Lot - A tax lot that is too narrow to accommodate a building. The lot is usually 12 feet or less in width.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Submerged Land Lot - A tax lot that is totally or almost completely submerged.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: A code describing the basement type/grade. (All basements in brownstones, high ranches, split-levels and attached row houses are Above Grade.)
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Full Basement that is Above Grade (The basement is 75% or more of the area of the first floor and the basement walls are at least 4 feet high on at least two sides).
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Full Basement that is Below Grade (The basement is 75% or more of the area of the first floor and the basement walls are fully submerged or are less than 4 feet on at least three sides).
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Partial Basement that is Above Grade (The basement is between 25% and 75% of the area of the first floor and the basement walls are at least 4 feet high on at least two sides).
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: Partial Basement that is Below Grade (The basement is between 25% and 75% of the area of the first floor and the basement walls are fully submerged or are less than 4 feet on at least three sides).
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: This information is ONLY available for one, two or three family structures.

attr.attrdef: The actual assessed land value as of the fiscal year of the date of the DOF data.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrvae: The Department of Finance calculates the assessed value by multiplying the tax lot's estimated full market land value, determined as if vacant and unimproved, by a uniform percentage for the property's tax class.

attr.attrdef: The actual assessed total value as of the fiscal year of the date of the DOF data.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrvae: The Department of Finance calculates the assessed value by multiplying the tax lot's estimated full market value by a uniform percentage for the property'stax lot's estimated full market value by a uniform percentage for the property's tax class.

attr.attrdef: The actual exempt land value, which is determined differently for each exemption program, is that portion of the tax lot that has received an exemption or abatement as of the fiscal year of the date of the DOF data.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attr.attrdef: The actual exempt total value, which is determined differently for each exemption program, is that portion of the tax lot that has received an exemption or abatement as of the fiscal year of the date of the DOF data.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attr.attrdef: The year construction of the building was completed.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attr.attrdef: A code indicating whether the year the building was built (YearBuilt) was an estimate.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

edom.edomvd: Year Built is not an Estimate
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attr.attrdef: The year of the most recent alteration.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrvae: If the alteration spanned more than one year, YearAlter1 is the year the alteration began, otherwise it is the year the alteration was completed. The date can either be the actual date or an estimate. The Department of Finance defines modifications to the structure that, according to the assesor, changes the value of the real property.

attr.attrdef: The year of the second most recent alteration.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attrvai.attrvae: If the alteration spanned more than one year, YearAlter2 is the year the alteration began, otherwise it is the year the alteration was completed. The date can either be the actual date or an estimate. The Department of Finance defines modifications to the structure that, according to the assesor, changes the value of the real property.

attr.attrdef: The name of the historic district as designated by the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Buildings

attr.attrdef: The name of an individual landmark, landmark site (e.g. Richmondtown Restoration), or an interior landmark, as designated by the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: The Built Floor Area Ratio (FAR) is the total building floor area divided by the area of the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: The calculation by City Planning is based on rough building and lot measurements provided by the Department of Finance. FAR is calculated using the TotlArea and the LotArea. The LotArea contains street beds when the lot contains paper streets.

attr.attrdef: Either the Maximum Allowable Residential Floor Area Ratio (FAR) or the Maximum Allowable Commercial FAR. If ZONING, ALL COMPONENTS 1 begins with M (manufacturing) or C If ZONING, ALL COMPONENTS 1 begins with M (manufacturing) or C. If ZONING, ALL COMPONENTS 1 begins with R (residential) then the
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: The Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratios are exclusive of bonuses for plazas, plaza-connected open areas, arcades or other amenities.

attr.attrdef: The borough the tax lot is located in.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: Two portions of the city, Marble Hill and Rikers Island, are each loegally located in one borough but are serviced by different broughs. The BOROCODE associated with these areas are the boroughs they are legally located in. Specifically, Marble Hill is serviced by the Bronx but is legally located in Manhattan and has a Manhattan BOROCODE. Rikers Island has a Bronx BOROCODE because it is legally located in the Bronx although it is serviced by Queens.

attr.attrdef: A concatenation of the BoroCode, TaxBlock and the corresponding TaxLot. This field consists of the tax block followed by the tax lot. The tax block is one to five numeric digits, preceded with leading blanks when the block is less than five digits. The tax lot is one to four digits and is preceded with leading zeros when the lot is less than four digits. The tax block is one to five digits and is preceded with leading zeros when the lot is less than five digits.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: The condominium number assigned to the complex.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Finance

attr.attrdef: The 2000 census tract that the tax lot is located in.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: 2000 Census Tracts geographic areas defined by the US Census Bureau for the 2000 Census.

attr.attrdef: The X coordinate of the XY coordinate pair which depicts the approximate location of the address.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: The XY coordinates are expressed in the New York- Long Island State Plane Coordinate System (NAD83). Currently, the XY coordinates are not available for properties fronting on curved streets.

attr.attrdef: The Y coordinate of the XY coordinate pair which depicts the approximate location of the address.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: The XY coordinates are expressed in the New York- Long Island State Plane Coordinate System (NAD83). Currently, the XY coordinates are not available for properties fronting on curved streets.

attr.attrdef: The Department of City Planning Zoning Map Number associated with the tax lot's X and Y coordinates.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: The Sanborn Map Company map number associated with the tax block and lot. Sanborn map number format is Borough Code / Volume Number / Page Number.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: The Department of Finance map number associated with the tax block and lot. Tax map number format is Borough Code / Volume Number / Page Number.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: The E-Designation number assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: A code indicating whether the tax lot is in the PLUTO file and/or the Tax Block and Lot Clipped to the Shoreline File and/or Tax Block and Lot Not Clipped to the Shoreline File.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: In PLUTO Data File and in Tax Block and Lot Not Clipped to the Shoreline File.
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning
New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: In Tax Block and Lot Clipped to the Shoreline File Only
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: In PLUTO Data File and in COGIS Tax Block and Lot Not Clipped to the Shoreline File but NOT in Tax Block and Lot Clipped to the Shoreline File, therefore the tax lot is totally under water
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

edom.edomvd: In Tax Block and Lot Not Clipped to the Shoreline File Only, therefore the tax lot is totally under water
edom.edomvds: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attrvai.attrvae: The tax lot will not appear on the Department of City Planning Tax Block and Lot Files if the lot is found only in the PLUTO data file. If the tax lot has a COGIS PLUTO Indicator of 3 or 5, the PLUTO record will only contain data in the borough, tax block, tax lot, community district and COGIS PLUTO Indicator fields. Usually, these tax lots are psuedo lots created by DCP for street malls (e.g. Broadway Malls, Queens Blvd.) or tax lots totally under water.

attr.attrdef: The version of MapPLUTO.
attr.attrdefs: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of City Planning

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.
attr.attrdefs: Environmental Systems Research Institute (Redlands, Calif.)

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Shape length
attr.attrdefs: Environmental Systems Research Institute (Redlands, Calif.)

attr.attrdef: Shape length
attr.attrdefs: Environmental Systems Research Institute (Redlands, Calif.)
